page.title: 18Tourism, Swainby & Potto
page.content: Swainby has always attracted tourists, - day trippers and holiday visitors. Today it is a popular starting point for{ramblers and walkers}who leave their cars and head for the hills. The National Park Authority provides a map of the area. Cleveland Way walkers sometimes break their route here. Children from Carlton Outdoor Centre often walk to Swainby. On fine Sundays people come out to enjoy the scenery. Local shops benefit from tourism but there is no teashop; two of the inns serve coffee and bar meals. On the A19 at Trenholme there are 2 motorway-type eating places, and Potto Hall and the "Dog and Gun" offer accommodation and restaurant service. One{caravan site} in Swainby has 64 vans; another caters for touring vans and campers. Trenholme has 2 small caravan sites with application to extend.
